name: Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre Hotel

reviews.text: I can say that this is a very good hotel. Everything was great. There is nothing to complaint about!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: A great hotel with all of the service and standards you expect from the Marriott.
reviews.title: Perfect location for Toronto.

reviews.text: Next door to the Eaton Centre so perfect for shoppers.
reviews.title: Great location nice people good value

reviews.text: The proximity of restaurants give a great selection to diners.
reviews.title: Great Location for Teen Tourists

reviews.text: Got a great deal by paying in advance.
reviews.title: Good location however we are not choosing this hotel again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Calm, dignified, relaxing lobby, standard Marriott rooms and facilities, and a better-than-expected bar/resto contribute to the agreeable sense of providing a safe haven in the most boisterous part of Canada's megalopolis.
reviews.title: Pleasant oasis in the tumult of the Eaton Centre

reviews.text: Comfortable room.....but lacking value. Stayed at this Marriott while attending my employers annual convention. The staff was attentive and always friendly and helpful. The room was clean but a little worn is spots. The housekeeping staff did a stellar job everyday. Where the Marriott like so many others fell down was the value for their guest. Charging guests $15.95 CAN per night for wireless internet in a bit excessive. This was illustrated by the number of guests in the lobby taking advantage of the only free wifi in the hotel. In today’s wired world free wifi is what makes a good hotel a better hotel. Plus lose the pay per view movies and add a little HD content to the TV channel selections.
reviews.title: Comfortable room....

reviews.text: I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The location is very good too, connected to Eaton Centre. We were upgraded to a corner room with a separate bedroom and loved it. The breakfast buffett with omelette station was a big hit. especially since it was complementary with our elite status. No issues with this place, and I certainly would return again.
reviews.title: Very nice stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here. They had trouble getting both of our rooms listed under our platinum status. I give the concierge 1 star. He was very arrogant, promised us 4 fifth row center floor tickets to West Side Story--we got right side third row balcony seats! Then he bragged about how much money he saved us with his "concierge discount." We let him buy our hop on hop off tickets--they cost $5 more than the list price & he didn't get the senior rate for two of us. Check-in people were very friendly & helpful, just mixed up a few things. Food in concierge room nothing special. Typical room.
reviews.title: No wow factor here.

reviews.text: They seem to pawn off a crappy room at first but do agree to change it. Same thing again this time- we go twice a year for a conference. Noise from adjoining room but at least settled by 11:30 p.m.
reviews.title: Pretty consistent

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because they were running a special $150/night and that was the cheapeast we could find in downton Toronto. This place was fantastic. We stayed in a double bedroom with our family for 3 nights and there was plenty of room. Sheets, carpet, bathroom were all clean and the maid service did a great job. Parking was $26/day and you get in-out priveleges and in room wifi cost $15/day (free in the lobby). The front desk was very nice and accomodating. You can't beat this location anywhere else in Toronto. Eaton Mall, Yonge and Dundas all within walking distance. Anyplace else just hop on the subway or a trolley and your there in no time. The pool and hottub were both clean and functioning. The view from the pool is very pretty. The only mishap while we stayed there was the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, but the staff did their best to get us back into our rooms as quickly as possible.
reviews.title: Convenient and Clean

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for only 1 night - but it was very nice. The room was spacious, the beds very comfortagble and the staff very helpful. Great location close to all the action in downtown Toronto.
reviews.title: very nice stay at the Marriott

reviews.text: I have stayed at all of the chain hotels in Toronto: Hilton, Sheraton, Intercontinental, etc., and without question, the Marriott Eaton Centre is a cut, or two, or three, above the rest.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.text: I decided to take my uncle and aunt to Toronto for their 40th wedding anniversary for some shopping, shows, and baseball. We could not have been treated any better from the moment we checked in until we checked out. Kudos to the entire Marriott staff for their warmth, friendliness, and hospitality.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As described by previous reviewers, the Marriott is centrally located. It is attached to the Eaton Centre mall, and within walking distance of the theatre district, the Bloor Street boutique shops, the Air Canada Centre, the Rogers Centre, Chinatown, the Harbourfront, and the museums. In other words, anything one would want to see in Toronto can be easily reached from the Marriott.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: It is right beside Eaton Centre which is a big shopping mall with several restaurants as well. The subway station was just a couple blocks away so we took the subway to get to the CN Tower. At the corner we were able to take the streetcar which took us to Chinatown. Rooms were clean and staff were helpful. We got a great online rate which included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was more than the usual since it also included an omelette bar. There was a lot of cozy areas in the lobby and lounge area for free Wi-Fi access.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great service.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott on the weekend. Staff were friendly, check-in was quick. Location is very convenient being connected to the Eatons centre. Being a Marriott Rewards Member we had a plate of fresh fruit delivered to the room within minutes of our arrival. I Honestly felt like a celebrity.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Our stay at the Marriot was good, the front desk staff was really nice and helpful, the rooms are standard for Marriot, good beds and pillows. I enjoyed the location as it allowed us to go shoppint to Eaton Cenre on our spare time, also, it is within walking distance to multiple nice dinning venues. Breakfast is average.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Excellent location, if a little soul-less in a concrete jungle (but that's much of downtown Toronto). Easy check-in, excellent, large corner room with windows on two sides, a great king size bed, and a low online room rate. Only downers: small bath and poor shower - better if they took the bath out and put in a decent walk-in shower - and no breakfast included, and it's expensive, but plenty of options nearby - check out downstairs mall at Atrium on Bay – and NO FREE WIFI. Marriott, get with the program on the last point.
reviews.title: Good business stay

reviews.text: I grew up in Toronto and went to school, worked and played in Toronto and so therefore know Toronto intimately. We return many times a year and stay at this hotel TWICE a year. Each time I have found the staff to be extremely helpfull. The rooms and bathroom are clean with good amenities. Should you think you require something additional such as special pillows, soap, shampoo etc., then a phone call will get you exactly what you expect within 5 minutes and with lovely courtesy. The beds are comfortable as are the pillows. We order room service at least one of the mornings that we stay and it is always excellent - comes on time - comes fresh and warm - and with a lovely courteous staff member. I would recommend this hotel. FABULOUS location. Almost "on top" of the Eaton Centre" and so fantastically in the heart of Toronto - if you like to walk then this is the best centrally located hotel. Do not overlook this hotel as an option for good value & cleanliness in Toronto. The bad reviews are unfounded.....at least for us that have stayed there at least 8 times in different rooms. We have stayed at the Four Seasons (on many occassions) in Yorkville and found the Mariott Eaton Centre to be a serious, yet different contender.
reviews.title: Good hotel with great staff

description: Welcome to Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre hotel. An upscale downtown Toronto hotel and guest suites offers hi tech business meeting rooms for the business traveler, with free Wi-Fi in public areas and an array of family vacation packages.
